text:
A Tavern Encounter

A dim tavern, two drunken men at a table.  
The air is thick with tension.  
Drunk Man 1: “His wife a year he fondly loved…”  
Drunk Man 2: “Shut up! No one cares!”  

---

A retired clerk sits alone, sipping nervously.  
His eyes dart around the room.  
Clerk: “What a strange crowd…”  
Clerk: “I need to leave soon.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov observes a drunken man in a tavern, highlighting the contrasting reactions of the patrons to his antics.
